resources.string: There Is No Such Thing As A Stupid Question
What is a good amount of time to be stuck before asking a question?
1 - 2 minutes
15 - 20 minutes
3 - 4 hours
1 - 2 days
True or false: To prove that you are a good engineer when joining a new team, you should ask as few questions as possible.
What is the optimal amount of questions to ask per week as a junior engineer?
True or false: Asking a lot of questions can help other people in your company and increase your respect within your team.
What are the benefits of asking a lot of good questions?
You learn faster
You help other people who have the same question
You are creating a useful piece of content via your question and answer pair
Asking Effective Questions That Get Great Answers Quickly
What are some things you can do to improve your question?
Do a Google search for it and include what you were able or unable to get from them
Describe what you have already tried to solve your issue
Preemptively thank anybody who takes the time to read and answer your question
True or false: Ideally, your question takes less time to answer than it took for you to ask the question.
What is the core operating principle behind asking and answering questions?
Use StackOverflow
Attach every single line of relevant code you are working with if you are asking a software question
Questions are an exchange of time
True or false: In order to be polite, you should preface your question with a simple greeting like [Hello]. After the potential answerer responds, then you can ask your question.
Why do you need to attach a lot of context and be as specific as possible asking questions in tech?
Longer questions are better
It filters out the people who are not serious about answering your question
Tech is an effectively infinite space, so this narrows down the problem space for answerers
Bad Question vs. Good Question Example
Is the following a good question: What are the best open-source projects to work on?
[What are the best open-source projects to work on?] - How can the asker improve this question?
Include context on why they want to work on open-source
Describe their current experience level working with open-source
Outline the programming languages and frameworks they are already familiar with
Is the following a good question: Any Java developers here who have worked on ML?
[Any Java developers here who have worked on ML?] - Why is this not a good question?
Java is not a good language for machine learning
The true objective of the asker is not there
It should have a greeting like [Hello] to be polite
Is the following a good question: Does anybody know what the front-end engineering interview for Amazon looks like?
[Does anybody know what the front-end engineering interview for Amazon looks like?] - How can the asker improve this question?
Include what they have found out through Glassdoor and their recruiter

Reframe this question to have their true intention, which is that they have this interview coming up and would like help with it. They can then add information like when the interview is and the office/team it is for
Preemptively thank those who take the time to answer this question as sharing interview material is dicey due to NDA
Is the following a good question: Can someone recommend me resources for blockchain development?
[Can someone recommend me resources for blockchain development?] - How can the asker improve this question?
Explain why they are interested in blockchain
Include the preferred way they like to learn (video, article, etc)
Describe what kind of product they are looking to build with blockchain
Is the following a good question: Is there anybody here who can refer me into FAANG?
[Is there anybody here who can refer me into FAANG?] - Why is this not a good question?
It is very unlikely somebody is willing to do such a massive favor for someone they do not know
Everybody wants to get into FAANG. It is hard to empathize with the asker, especially as they have not described any difficulties they have faced trying to get into FAANG
For an ask this large, it should definitely have a preemptive thanks
